marketNews.title: Effective VAT for General Goods & Services Remains 11%
marketNews.content: The Government on Tuesday (12/31) announced several important points regarding the increase in Value Added Tax (VAT) effective January 1, 2025: - The VAT increase from 11% to 12% only applies to luxury goods as listed in Minister of Finance Regulation No. 15/2023 and Minister of Finance Regulation No. 42/2022. - Goods and services that have been exempt from VAT experience no change. - General goods and services that have been subject to 11% VAT do not experience an effective VAT increase, so the VAT rate remains 11% of the selling price. Technically, the government is not canceling the 12% VAT rate for general goods and services, but rather by applying a tax base (DPP) of 11/12 of the selling price or import value. This application is regulated in Minister of Finance Regulation No. 131/2024 and will result in the imposition of VAT on general goods and services remaining at 11% of the selling price or import value. As an illustration, a general item with a selling price of 10 million rupiah will have a tax base amounting to 9.17 million rupiah, resulting from 11/12 x 10 million rupiah. This tax base is then subject to 12% VAT, resulting in a total VAT of 1.1 million rupiah. Thus, the effective VAT rate is 11% of its selling price, even though the VAT rate rises to 12%. Based on the simulation above, the amount of VAT paid for general goods and services remains the same. The announcement - especially point 3 - simultaneously revokes the written statement from the Directorate General of Taxes on December 21, 2024, which stated that the VAT increase from 11% to 12% per January 1, 2025, applies to all goods and services previously subject to the 11% rate, with the exception of bulk cooking oil 'Minyakita', wheat flour, and industrial sugar. Furthermore, the government also mentioned that the economic stimulus package announced on December 16, 2024, will remain in effect. Key Takeaway: The cancellation of the VAT increase for general goods and services and the continued validity of the stimulus package have the potential to provide positive sentiment for the consumer sector - especially the lower to middle segments such as ICBP, MYOR, and TSPC - because it can maintain public purchasing power, especially in 1H25. However, there is still a risk of price increases if a number of business actors have already raised selling prices and do not cancel them. Responding to this development, the IHSG closed up +1.18% at the level of 7,163 in today's trading, Thursday (2/1). *This article was first published in Stockbit Commentary on Thursday (2/1) morning.

tickerNews.title: DEWA: Debt Conversion of Rp1.1 T at Price of Rp65/Share
tickerNews.content: DEWA: Darma Henwa plans to conduct a private placement of approximately 17.2 billion new shares at a price of 65 rupiah per share to convert debt amounting to approximately 1.1 trillion rupiah. The dilution effect from this corporate action reaches 44%. There are 2 parties that will take part in this private placement, namely PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara and PT Andhesti Tungkas Pratama, with their respective ownership reaching 29.8% and 14.2%. Previously, these two companies did not have share ownership in DEWA. This plan will be discussed in the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on February 13, 2025.

tickerNews.title: ERAL Signs Distribution Agreement for XPeng Electric Vehicles in Indonesia
tickerNews.content: ERAL: Sinar Eka Selaras through its subsidiary, PT Era Inovasi Otomotif, signed a cooperation agreement with Shenzhen Xiaopeng Motors Supply Chain Management Co. Ltd. to become the official distributor and sole trademark holder agent for XPeng electric cars in Indonesia. This cooperation marks ERAL's expansion into the electric vehicle business.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Increases Ownership in SCMA to 61.91% Following December Purchases
tickerNews.content: SCMA: Surya Citra Media's controller, Elang Mahkota Teknologi (EMTK), purchased approximately 343.7 million SCMA shares at an average price of 160.9 rupiah per share on December 18-30, 2024. The total transaction value reached 55.3 billion rupiah. After this transaction, EMTK's ownership in SCMA increased from 61.44% to 61.91%. This transaction marks the 5th purchase of SCMA shares by EMTK during December 2024, with a total of 690.5 million (0.94%) shares purchased.

tickerNews.title: PTRO Director and Commissioner Acquire Shares
tickerNews.content: PTRO: Petrosea's President Director, Michael, purchased 80,000 PTRO shares at an average price of 25,000 rupiah per share on December 20, 2024. The total transaction value reached 2 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Michael's ownership in PTRO increased from 0.0059% to 0.0139%. In a separate transaction, PTRO's Commissioner, Erwin Ciputra, also purchased 60,000 PTRO shares at an average price of 28,233 rupiah per share on December 23, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 1.7 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Erwin Ciputra's ownership in PTRO increased from 0.062% to 0.068%.

tickerNews.title: LABA Plans Rights Issue for EV Battery Business Development and Partners with Safago to Sell Battery Packs
tickerNews.content: LABA: Green Power Group's President Director, William Ong, stated in a public expose on December 24, 2024, that the company plans to conduct a rights issue along with the issuance of warrants in 1H25, targeting fund acquisition ranging from 100-150 billion rupiah and 150-250 billion rupiah, respectively. This corporate action already has standby buyers and will be followed by existing investors, and is aimed at developing the electric vehicle battery business. Additionally, LABA will increase its debt by 300-400 billion rupiah. The company itself targets revenue of 621 billion rupiah and net profit of 40 billion rupiah during 2025. In a separate information disclosure, LABA announced a cooperation with PT Safago New Energy to sell 6,000 battery packs per year until 2029.

tickerNews.title: HEAL Plans 2 New Hospitals and 1 Acquisition in 2025 with CapEx of Rp1.5 Trillion
tickerNews.content: HEAL: Medikaloka Hermina's President Director, Hasmoro, stated that the company plans to build 2 new hospitals and acquire at least 1 hospital during 2025. To realize this plan, HEAL allocates capex of 1.5 trillion rupiah in 2025 (vs. 2024 allocation: 2 trillion rupiah). HEAL views the prospects for this year positively, with revenue and EBITDA growth targets for 2025 around +13-15%.

tickerNews.title: AMRT Commissioner Sells 31.7 Million Shares in December 2024
tickerNews.content: AMRT: Sumber Alfaria Trijaya's Commissioner, Budiyanto Djoko Susanto, sold approximately 31.7 million AMRT shares at an average price of 2,850 rupiah per share on December 27, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 90.2 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Budiyanto Djoko Susanto's ownership in AMRT decreased from 0.32% to 0.25%.

tickerNews.title: BNGA's November 2024 Net Profit Decreases YoY, NIM Hits 2024 Low
tickerNews.content: BNGA: Bank CIMB Niaga recorded a net profit (bank only) of 435 billion rupiah (-3.5% YoY, +1% MoM) in November 2024, resulting in a cumulative net profit (bank only) for 11M24 reaching 5.9 trillion rupiah (+4.8% YoY). The monthly Net Interest Margin (NIM) fell to its lowest level in 2024 at 3.43% (-37 bps YoY, -26 bps MoM), causing the NIM for 11M24 to drop to 3.81% (-34 bps YoY). Profitability decline also continued at the Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP) level, weakening in November 2024 (-13% YoY, -26% MoM), although PPOP for 11M24 (-2.4% YoY) did not significantly decrease. On the other hand, the monthly credit cost (CoC) achieved its best realization in 2024 at 0.14% (-39 bps YoY, -31 bps MoM), so the CoC for 11M24 became 0.61% (-31 bps YoY). Meanwhile, credit growth (including sharia financing) reached +7.2% YoY, the highest in 2024.

tickerNews.title: BSSR Plans Second Interim Dividend for 2024 Book Year Worth US$25 Million
tickerNews.content: BSSR: Baramulti Suksessarana plans to distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 book year amounting to 25 million US dollars or 154.39 rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiated market is January 9, 2025, with payment on January 15, 2025. Referring to BSSR's stock price at the closing of Thursday's (2/1) trading at 4,550 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 3.4%. This is BSSR's second interim dividend distribution for the 2024 book year, following the interim dividend of 179.19 rupiah per share in November 2024.

tickerNews.title: Indo Alam Resources Pte. Ltd. Increases Stake in NSSS to 5.91%
tickerNews.content: NSSS: Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera shareholder, Indo Alam Resources Pte. Ltd., purchased approximately 586.8 million NSSS shares at an average price of 261 rupiah per share on December 27, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 153 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Indo Alam Resources Pte Ltd's ownership in NSSS increased from 3.45% to 5.91%.

tickerNews.title: WIKA Records Rp19.9 Trillion in New Contracts in 11M24 and Faces Rating Downgrade Due to Bond/Sukuk Approval Issues
tickerNews.content: WIKA: Wijaya Karya recorded new contract value of 19.9 trillion rupiah during 11M24, equivalent to 53.8% of the 2024 target of 37 trillion rupiah. WIKA also announced that Pefindo has revised the rating of the company and its securities from idBBB- stable outlook category to idBB- credit watch category because the company has not obtained a quorum of approval from bondholders and the Sustainable Sukuk Mudharabah II Phase II 2022 on December 16-17, 2024. In the RUPO, WIKA proposed a partial repayment and extension of the remaining principal amount of the Sustainable Bond II Phase II 2022 Series A, which is due on February 18, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Headline Macroeconomic Updates (Inflation, PMI, Tourism, Budget, US Debt, Nickel, B40 Delay, HPP, BEI Targets, Corporate Actions)
tickerNews.content: BPS recorded that the Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation in December 2024 reached 1.57% YoY (vs. November 2024: 1.55% YoY inflation), below the consensus expectation of 1.6% YoY but still within Bank Indonesia's target range of 1.5-3.5%. This is Indonesia's lowest annual inflation in history. On a monthly basis, CPI inflation reached 0.44% MoM (vs. November 2024: 0.3% MoM inflation), in line with expectations and marking the highest increase in the last 9 months. The monthly inflation increase was driven by the food, beverage, and tobacco group which experienced 1.33% MoM inflation, contributing 0.38 percentage point to inflation. Core inflation remained stable at 2.26% YoY, holding at its highest level in the last 16 months although lower than the consensus expectation of 2.28% YoY. S&P Global noted that Indonesia's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rose to 51.2 in December 2024 (vs. November 2024: 49.6), marking the first factory activity expansion since June 2024 along with moderately growing output. New orders in December 2024 increased for the first time in the last 6 months, while overseas sales rose slightly, marking the first increase in almost a year. S&P Global noted that China's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) fell to 50.5 in December 2024 (vs. November 2024: 51.5), lower than the consensus expectation of 51.7 although it marked factory activity expansion for 3 consecutive months. Production and new order growth slowed, while orders from abroad contracted after increasing at the fastest pace in 7 months the previous month. BPS recorded that foreign tourist arrivals (wisman) to Indonesia reached 1.09 million (-8.4% MoM, +17.3% YoY) in November 2024. This result caused foreign tourist arrivals to Indonesia during 11M24 to increase by +20.17% YoY to ~12.7 million, equivalent to 90.4% of the government's 2024 target of 14 million. Finance Minister, Sri Mulyani, stated on Thursday (2/1) that the 2024 State Budget deficit was below the government's latest estimate of 2.7% of GDP. Although Sri Mulyani did not detail the exact figure, she said the deficit was nearly equivalent to the government's initial plan to keep the 2024 State Budget deficit at 2.29% of GDP. Sri Mulyani mentioned that state revenues generally still grew, although below target. Meanwhile, state expenditures in 2024 grew by more than +6% YoY along with the general election, new capital city development projects, and social assistance programs. US Treasury Secretary, Janet Yellen, said on Friday (12/27) that the US would hit its debt limit between January 14-23, 2025. Yellen mentioned that the US Congress needs to take 'extraordinary steps' to prevent a US debt default. The Advisory Board of the Indonesian Nickel Miners Association (APNI), Djoko Widajatno, stated that they hope the government does not cut the nickel ore production quota in 2025, considering nickel ore needs will increase this year along with the development of the downstream nickel industry. APNI projects nickel ore needs in 2025 to reach 400-450 million tons, an increase of approximately +60% YoY. Previously, Kontan reported that the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources plans to cut the nickel ore production quota to 150 million tons in 2025, a decrease of -44.9% compared to 2024 production of 272 million tons. Reuters reported on Thursday (2/1) that Indonesia has not implemented biodiesel with a 40% CPO blend, or B40, because industry players are still awaiting technical regulations regarding its launch. Previously, B40 implementation was scheduled for January 1, 2025. The Secretary General of the Indonesian Biofuel Producers Association, Ernest Gunawan, said that its members cannot make contracts for biodiesel distribution without government regulations. Meanwhile, Reuters reported that CPO traders are still waiting for the official volume of biodiesel that Indonesia will allocate to fuel retailers, to gauge how much CPO exports from Indonesia will be affected by this policy. The government previously stated it would allocate 15.62 million kiloliters of palm oil-based fuel for B40 in 2025. Coordinating Minister for Food Affairs, Zulkifli Hasan, stated that the government through Bulog will purchase all harvest yields not absorbed by the market. Additionally, the government officially raised the government purchase price (HPP) for rice from 6,000 rupiah per kg to 6,500 rupiah per kg and corn from 5,000 rupiah per kg to 5,500 rupiah per kg. IDX President Director, Iman Rachman, stated that the exchange targets an average daily stock transaction value of 13.5 trillion rupiah, up +4.7% YoY from the realization during 2024 of 12.9 trillion rupiah. The IDX also targets an increase in the number of investors by 2 million from the current level of 14.84 million investors. The IDX also targets 66 stock IPOs during 2025, higher than the 2024 realization of 41 issuers. Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia (ACES) announced AZKO as its new brand identity, following the non-renewal of the license with ACE Hardware International Holdings Ltd. after a 29-year cooperation. Diamond Food Indonesia (DMND) controllers, Chen Tsen Nan and Kenneth Chen, sold approximately 446 million shares and approximately 212 million shares of DMND, respectively, at an average price of 765 rupiah per share on December 20, 2024. The transaction values reached approximately 341 billion rupiah and 162 billion rupiah, respectively, and were intended to fulfill the free float requirement. After this transaction, the ownership of Chen Tsen Nan and Kenneth Chen in DMND decreased from 39.635% and 22.107% to 34.926% and 19.872%, respectively. Communication Cable Systems Indonesia (CCSI) plans to conduct a rights issue of up to approximately 133.3 million new shares, with an exercise price of 383 rupiah per share and a dilution effect of up to 10%. The maximum potential fund acquisition reaches approximately 51.1 billion rupiah, intended to repay part of bank debt. Central Business Alliance Pte. Ltd. will act as a standby buyer in this rights issue. Cumulative rights in the regular and negotiated market is January 6, 2025, with an indicative rights trading period from January 10-16, 2025.
